title: on it by section 79 of the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011 (No. 40 of
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Property Services (Maintenance
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Property Services (Maintenance 

of Professional Competence of Licensees) (Amendment) Regulations 2020.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited property service (maintenance professional competence licensees) (amendment) regulation 2020

title: on it by section 79 of the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011 (No. 40 of
heading: 2. The Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011 (Maintenance of
text_raw:
2. The Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011 (Maintenance of 
Professional Competence of Licensees) Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 576 of 2017) 
are amended - 

(a) 

in Regulation 2, by – 

the deletion of the definitions of “E-Learning”, “Professional 
Competence Scheme Category of General Management” and 
“Professional 
of 
Legislation/Regulation”, 

Competence 

Category 

Scheme 

(b) 

in Regulation 4, by – 

the deletion of paragraph (4), and 

(c) 

by substitution for Regulation 5 the following: 

“5. (1) Licensees shall be required to undertake a minimum 
of five Verifiable Hours of education and training by completion 
of Professional Competence Scheme Programmes 
the 
Professional Competence Scheme Cycle. 

in 

(2) The modules of the Professional Competence Scheme 
Programmes shall be agreed by the Authority with the 
Professional Competence Scheme Accredited Providers. 

(3) The content of the Professional Competence Scheme 
Programme modules, shall be submitted by the Professional 
Competence Scheme Accredited Providers, for approval by the 
Authority. 

(4) A Licensee shall complete all mandatory modules set out 
in the Professional Competence Scheme Programmes in the 
Professional Competence Scheme Cycle. 

(5) A Licensee shall not carry forward surplus hours 
accredited by Professional Competence Scheme Accredited 
Providers at the end of a Professional Competence Scheme 
cycle.”. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 18th September, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [348] 3 

The Minister for Justice and Equality consents to the making of the foregoing 
Regulations. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

16 September, 2020. 

HELEN MCENTEE, 

Minister for Justice and Equality. 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Property Services 
Regulatory Authority, 

17 September 2020. 

MAEVE HOGAN 

Chief Executive, Property Services Regulatory 
Authority. 

GERALDINE CLARKE 

Chairperson, Property Services Regulatory Authority 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [348]

title: on it by section 79 of the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011 (No. 40 of
heading: (This note is not part of the Statutory Instrument and does not purport to be a
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Statutory Instrument and does not purport to be a 
legal interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the Property Services (Regulation) Act 2011 
(Maintenance of Professional Competence of Licensees) Regulations 2017 (S.I. 
No. 576 of 2017). 

These Regulations lay down arrangements for determining the content of the 
Professional Competence Scheme Programmes and allow for the delivery of the 
entire programmes online. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [348] 5
